website_summaries.verdict: Killer throughput, a good feature set and easy setup makes the Trendnet AC1750 Dual Band Wireless Router (TEW-812DRU)  an excellent 11ac router.
cons: Sluggish switching among screens in interface

customer_reviews.title: last unit it seems
customer_reviews.text: In two words: NOT WORKING. Lights are on, gets a bit warm but otherwise it allocates me some 164.xxx.xxx.xxx address that lets me out of accessing it. Reset button did not help. Power led and usb led stay on. Blinks the internet led and the lan but nothing else. Three other cables did not make a difference. Older laptop on win7 and a more recent desktop win10 did not find a way to get the login page. Raspberry pi did not understand this router either. Straight to bin (so that Amazon does not send this unit to someone else) and no more head banging TRENDnet again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good Kit
customer_reviews.text: Bit dated but at this price was a bargain. had for a while now and no issues whatsoever! Much better than my Virgin media superhub for both wifi range and performance!
customer_reviews.author: Steve T

customer_reviews.title: Impressive speed and range
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this router, it is giving me massively faster speeds and increased range in my house compared to the Apple Airport Extreme router it replaced. I would recommend it wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: excellent job guys!
customer_reviews.text: feature packed, compatible with third party firmware (but you dont really need it) good price. solid.
customer_reviews.author: -x-

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Worked well with my Mac Pro 2013 in 11ac mode. Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Lien Seever

customer_reviews.title: Web interface so slow
customer_reviews.text: Well I had high hopes for this router, and all was well until I upgraded to the latest version of the firmware. Then the web interface (as accessed from my Windows 8 machine) became so slow that it took about 10 minutes to fully load a page. TRENDnet support has been next to useless. Funnily enough when I accessed the web interface from a windows 7 machine it seemed fine. Also the general design of the interface is pretty basic compared to my old netgear router. I'm going to send this back I think and get a decent router instead.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Reading

customer_reviews.title: Obsolete V1 Hardware Delivered
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this (BestBuyIT)and obsolete V1 H/W was delivered. Be warned. Sent straight back. Going for an ASUS RT-AC56U instead. Here's a comparison of the V1 and V2 TRENDnet
customer_reviews.author: K Marsh

customer_reviews.title: trendnet router review
customer_reviews.text: Router has from day one provided better wi-fi throughout our home. Set up took longer than expected and main pc on windows 7 didnt communicate with router. Had to revert to a laptop on XP to complete set-up
customer_reviews.author: Terence

customer_reviews.title: This is a discontinued product and is still being shipped with no warning to say it's discontinued - beware!
customer_reviews.text: Like the first reviewer, I was excited to receive my new kit only to find that it was the discontinued V1. Phoned amazon - great at dealing with it and requested to be sent the current V2, which they said they could do. Arrived today, and it's yet another V1.0R.... Not too happy. Will just return it and try somewhere else. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: blagga

customer_reviews.title: Old Stock
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to using the new router. I one I was sent was the old discontinued v1.0 of the router. The new v2.0 has many improvements and bug fixes. Amazon were great about taking this back so check to see what stock they have if you want the latest model.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Andreu

customer_reviews.title: Its not an ASDL Router - It needs another ISP Modem/Router?
customer_reviews.text: It's a misleading description. I assumed buying it would mean throwing away my old modem for something much better - not so. Two boxes, old and new, have to be wired up together for the unit to work? Having the "TRENDnet" logo [very large] plastered in your living room is TOTALLY NOT ACCEPTABLE! Its been a waste of my time, and Amazon have now got to put up with my return, sorry about that Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Keen DIY'er

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: The TEW-812DRU has all the standard router features, including virtual servers, IPv6, content filtering, and so on. For security, it also supports all variations of WPA, and WPA2 encryption standards. It also seems to offer very good range, up to around 250 feet by my own testing. However, it seems most effective when within 150 feet. With solid performance and competitive pricing on its side, Trendnet's AC1750 Dual Band Wireless router seems like a good alternative to the high-end Wireless-N N900 routers that don't support 802.11ac.
customer_reviews.author: Sam D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fast and trouble free
customer_reviews.text: Really simple set-up, and has been trouble-free ever since. As fast as my previous router, and copes well with the thick walls of my house
customer_reviews.author: A family of goats

product_meta.title: TRENDnet TEW-812DRU AC1750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Cable Router (2.4GHz 450Mbps, 5GHz 1300Mbps)
product_meta.description:
Style Name:N300 PoE

TEW-812DRU AC1750 DUAL BAND WIRELESS ROUTER 
TRENDnet's AC1750 Dual Band Wireless Router, model TEW-812DRU, produces the ultimate wireless experience with gigabit wireless speeds. Manage 2 wireless networks -- the 1300 Mbps Wireless AC band for fast wireless, and the 450 Mbps Wireless N band to connect common wireless devices. The TEW-812DRU can easily handle the demands of multiple HD streams in a busy connected home.

Plug in a USB flash or NAS drive to share HD videos and music across the network. Gigabit ports on the back of the router maintain high-speed wired connections. Create a secure isolated guest network for guest internet access. Wi-Fi Protected Set-up (WPS) connects other WPS supported wireless adapters at the touch of a button. Manage access to websites and file types with advanced access controls.

View larger Gigabit Wireless: Next generation Gigabit Wireless AC
Simultaneous Dual Band: Gigabit Wireless AC band + Wireless N band for every day devices
One Touch Connection: Connect to the router at the touch of the Wi-Fi Protected Set-up (WPS) button 
Guest Network Access: Create an isolated network for guest internet access 
USB Share Port: Plug in a USB flash or NAS drive to share HD videos and music
Parental Controls: Control access to specific websites or types of content
Gigabit Wired: Gigabit Ethernet port maintains high performance network connections


OVERVIEW
 * 1750 Mbps total wireless: 1300 Mbps AC + 450 Mbps N bands
 * Share music and videos with the USB share port
 * Create an isolated guest network
 * One touch network connection with the WPS button
 * All Gigabit wired ports
 * High power amplifiers extend wireless coverage

NETWORKING SPECS
 * 4x 10/100/1000 Mbps Auto-MDIX LAN ports
 * 1x 10/100/1000 Mbps WAN port (Internet)
 * Supported connection types: Dynamic/Static IP, PPPoE, L2TP, and PPTP connection

WIRELESS SPECS
 * 2.412~2.462 GHz, 5.180~5.240 GHz, 5.725~5.850 GHz
 * 2.4GHz: 3 x 2dBi (internal)
 * 5GHz: 3 x 2dBi (internal)
 * 64/128-bit WEP, WPA/WPA2-PSK, WPA/WPA2-RADIUS

* Maximum wireless signal rates are referenced from IEEE 802.11 theoretical specifications. Actual data throughput and coverage will vary depending on interference, network traffic, building materials and other conditions



BOX CONTAINS


 * TEW-812DRU Router
 * Multi-Language Quick Installation Guide
 * CD-ROM (Utility and User's Guide)
 * 1 x Ethernet cable (1.5)
 * Power adaptor (12V, 1A)
feature_bullets: 802.11ac Gigabit Wireless-AC for transfer rates up to 1300Mbps using the interference free 5Ghz with simultaneous Dual Band: Gigabit Wireless AC band + Wireless N band for every day devices
One Touch Connection: Connect to the router at the touch of the Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) button and Guest Network Access: Create an isolated network for guest internet access
USB Share Port: Plug in a USB flash or NAS drive to share HD videos and music
Parental Controls: Control access to specific websites or types of content
Gigabit Wired: Gigabit Ethernet port maintains high performance network connections
